medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started 4 days prior to admission, predominantly in the RUQ and epigastric area, described as a feeling of fullness and distention. The pain was worst 3 days prior to admission, worsened with eating, and was relieved with ice packs and pressure. There was a decrease in appetite and small amounts of bilious vomiting. Mild improvement was noted yesterday and today, despite a migraine.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HCV cirrhosis s/p liver transplant, acute rejection with recurrent cholestatic HCV, CMV viremia treated with valgancyclovir, hypothyroidism, hypertension, osteoporosis, diabetes on insulin, chronic renal failure (baseline 1.5-1.9), depression, hypogonadism.
medical_history.family_history: Five siblings; some with thyroid and arthritis problems. No family history of liver or kidney disease.
medical_history.social_history: Recently re-started AA; notes members may have had pneumonia or gastroenteritis. Recent medication changes included increasing tacrolimus, decreasing valcyte, and increasing urodiol. Had consumed organic juice the day symptoms began.
